intro: Hedeomoides tenuiflora, commonly known as the slender-flowered hedeomoides, is a member of the Malvaceae family. It is a small, evergreen shrub characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and delicate, pale pink flowers. Native to the coastal regions of southern Australia, it thrives in sandy, well-drained soils. The plant is often found in heathlands and coastal dunes, where it contributes to the local biodiversity. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
